text: No. I decided that for most 3d plotting, it's not so important that you can fly through the data but that you pick an angle and scaling and that's mostly it. Which I needed to place the panes and labels etc correctly. Everything gets scaled down to -1 to 1 first, then the camera is positioned so that this cube is fully in view, then the projection is chosen given how much "perspective look" you want.
